column4: Great conversation yesterday with #GIAEDC leadership about ongoing development projects and how they have continued their efforts despite COVID-19 and how I can best support their efforts to grow Grand Island. #NE03 https://t.co/BKbq9G1yZm
Appreciated the opportunity to discuss the impact of COVID and direction of the economy with members of the Dundy County Chamber yesterday. #NE03 https://t.co/Hqa7dRBqIH

Great discussion with Osmond General Hospital today. Expanding access to telehealth and providing greater flexibility for rural health care facilities and staff matters. It is why I introduced the Rural Health Clinic Modernization Act & the RUSH Act. #NE03 https://t.co/EuZQ7ldt8l

Productive meeting with Harlan County Health System today. Ensuring opportunities for innovation & flexibility in rural health care is important. This is why I introduced the RUSH Act, and why I work to ensure CAHs and RHCs can provide essential primary care to Nebraskans. #NE03 https://t.co/LLy8eyFzng
Thanks to Howard County Medical Center leadership for the productive feedback last week on COVID-19 response and other topics. #NE03 https://t.co/NjMG7nvGIJ

Thanks to @NebraskaCRNA for the hard work Nebraska Nurse Anesthetists have done on the health care frontlines. #CRNAs have been vital in responding to the COVID pandemic, especially in rural areas like #NE03. https://t.co/Ve2s7T5Fy0
Thanks to @GburgHealth leadership for sharing their perspective on health care issues. #NE03 https://t.co/ES0YGAIz8B
Thanks to Aurora’s Memorial Community Health leadership for sharing their important perspective on health care this morning. #NE03 https://t.co/PlrNEJ692k

Vaccine development has been a top priority of our COVID response, with Congress and @POTUS working together on several important actions made possible by the CARES Act. My column here: https://t.co/vw46lotSCs

Appreciate all those who joined our Rural & Underserved Taskforce Telehealth Virtual Roundtable today. Rural health care got a big win recently with @RealDonaldTrump ‘s Executive Order. We must ensure high quality, affordable, and available heath care for rural Americans. https://t.co/sQTrSNNYk3

.@realdonaldtrump ‘s executive order is another great step in the right direction for rural health care. I thank the President and his administration for their commitment to rural America – during the pandemic and beyond. My statement here: https://t.co/cJgRIEjNuj

Nebraska airports remain as critical as ever despite the challenges of COVID-19. For this reason, I joined in introducing @SenatorFischer ‘s AIR Act in the House to provide needed relief for our airports. My release here: https://t.co/yG87ZbZohP

Great to join the @EthanolRFA Board meeting this week where we discussed efforts to tackle the #COVID19 challenges the biofuels industry is facing, including trade and SREs. Getting back to the record demand for ethanol before the pandemic is a top priority. https://t.co/awNY1vu0Vh

Telehealth has been critical to our COVID response where patients can engage with their medical providers while limiting travel and the spread of the virus. Telehealth is a life-saving tool & I am excited to support this @WaysandMeansGOP discussion draft! https://t.co/Jd1Bad7OVZ

Republicans on the @WaysandMeansGOP have introduced solutions to spur innovation and help solve the COVID crisis and beyond. Recently, @RepKevinBrady has unveiled the Faster Cures through Innovation Agenda – which has my full support. My column here: https://t.co/ZVmxC78xyc

Reminder: Due to the #COVID19 pandemic, @USTreasury delayed #TaxDay to today. Double check to ensure you have filed your tax return. If you need more time, you must still file for an extension by today. https://t.co/e8gb86LGR6

The ACA has been anything but affordable for Nebraska families. Instead of working together to fix health care, Speaker Pelosi brought Obamacare expansion up for a vote last week. My column here: https://t.co/jmngCDZBUS
My bill – The #RUSHAct – can make a difference for seniors in care centers and improve safety for seniors during this pandemic. Thanks @NTVNEWS for having me on! https://t.co/aVP8VWLghe
Ten years after we were told the #ACA would fix health care it has failed to control costs, but Speaker Pelosi now wants us to expand this failed system – I voted no. https://t.co/D7VEavsInp

Today, I spoke in opposition to H.R. 1425, which would ignore the vast problems and skyrocketing prices of Obamacare to expand this flawed system. We should be working together to fix health care, not this partisan proposal. Watch here: https://t.co/eZ3OW6pY1g
My weekly column>>>We continue to fight the health and economic effects of COVID-19, but we can’t forget our nation’s mounting debt: https://t.co/5aWQWObV5T

At today’s @WaysandMeansGOP hearing, I addressed the need to bring lifesaving technology like telehealth to nursing homes. My bill, the #RUSHAct would help transform rural health care and improve lives. https://t.co/sWk1Hr2fkf
The COVID-19 pandemic hasn’t stopped work on beneficial agreements to boost our economy. My column here: https://t.co/0F53SgUUfc

Yesterday I participated in a #BiofuelsCaucus town hall to discuss the ongoing biofuels issues during the pandemic and steps needed for recovery. It is critical that we hear from the industry so we can take their concerns to Congress. Thanks for everyone who joined! https://t.co/2PaGPsvjFj

While we continue working on COVID relief measures, we cannot ignore the skyrocketing debt we are accumulating. I joined @reparrington in calling for deficit reduction as part of future pandemic legislation to ensure we are addressing fiscal repercussions. https://t.co/i9rtsAGBw1
In our first @WaysandMeansGOP hearing since March, I discussed the importance of telehealth to ensuring all communities have access to health care. My column here: https://t.co/RwiBUkLnuL

In our first @WaysandMeansGOP Committee hearing back, I used my time to urge the adoption of my bill – the #RUSHAct  -- which cuts outdated red tape for telehealth and incentives this life saving technology. https://t.co/7sIXCbrcmu

Great to connect with the Nebraska Biodiesel Board this week. Ethanol was at record demands before #COVID19 and we must ensure our producers will be able to persevere this pandemic. Thank you for all you do! https://t.co/dpfpisu4fr

I appreciate @CSPAN for having me on this morning to discuss what the ongoing #COVID19 pandemic means for Nebraska, and the measures we are taking to fight it. You can watch the full interview here: https://t.co/ZchxNUZMgx
While COVID-19 has affected all of us, I am thankful we have technology to bridge the gap and keep us connected. My column here: https://t.co/B2KjgHMVFB
Speaker’s Pelosi’s $3 trillion bill full of partisan provisions will not defeat COVID-19 or restore our economy. I voted no. My statement: https://t.co/UFU4j9ceBj
COVID-19 has hit livestock producers particularly hard. They work overtime to feed our nation and deserve more than our thanks. My column here: https://t.co/cIbwcrsEP3

. @RepOHalleran and I have introduced H.R. 6792 which improves the telehealth fix created by the #CARESAct and gives rural clinics and their patients the freedom to use life-saving technologies like telehealth. Our release here: https://t.co/pcVCL27vHi

Much has changed in the four months since President Trump signed #USMCA into law back in December – not the least of which is the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. However, what has not changed is the importance of this agreement. My column here: https://t.co/rC8NoGsPmG

Thank you #NE03 constituents who participated in my ag webinar this morning. Undersec. Ibach and @usdafsa Admin. Fordyce shared great info on @USDA programs for producers during the #COVID19 pandemic. If you missed it, you can watch the full video here: : https://t.co/HuT3gTcDGb

The inclusion of small hospitals in #PPP is great news for rural America. @SenatorFischer and I have worked with the administration to fix this and are grateful to @POTUS for getting it done. Our statement here: https://t.co/ASwpv8vhOB

Small businesses are the lifeblood of rural America and #PPP has been critical to keeping them afloat during this pandemic. My statement on supporting Phase 3.5 of the COVID-19 response: https://t.co/Oc0QbkOp3L

Rural community hospitals are doing their part to fight COVID-19. To help them in this fight, @repterrisewell @RepArrington and I introduced a bill to include them in PPP. My release here: https://t.co/AAQ9GmulJQ

America relies on our farmers and ranchers to provide a strong, safe, and stable food supply. In the current #COVID19 situation, their importance is even more obvious. My column here: https://t.co/oq9wjTYZqY
The total worldwide shutdown from a pandemic and the concerning lack of transparency is a failure of the WHO. @realDonaldTrump is right to get to the bottom of these problems. https://t.co/nTmCDRXMG8

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19, Tuesday’s Service Academy Open House at the Gering Public Library is postponed.
For assistance with the academy nomination process, please contact my Grand Island office. #ne03 https://t.co/oLaRA1LjbX

While we continue the fight this #COVID19 we must also be sure to not let our guard down against fraud. Recently, there have been numerous reports of scams taking advantage of this pandemic. My column here: https://t.co/a7DBBV5D0b

During this pandemic, we cannot forget the millions of Americans who rely on rural hospitals and Rural Health Clinics for their primary care. @RepArrington and I wrote to @stevenmnuchin1 to ensure we include rural health in #CARESAct programs. My release:  https://t.co/jcSluPBikB

Access to quality health care is a challenge for rural communities under normal circumstances, let alone during this pandemic. This is why technologies such as telemedicine are so critical. https://t.co/DGWwpiFJ20

Nebraskans have taken drastic, but necessary measures to stop the spread of COVID-19, and it is clear a major disaster declaration is appropriate. I appreciate the leadership of @GovRicketts and @POTUS at this difficult time. My statement here: https://t.co/Q2QWM4ZaHv

Despite the crucial role our cattle producers play in feeding our nation during #COVID19 they are now having to weather low prices and market volatility. Because of this, I wrote to @USDA urging immediate assistance for cattle producers. My statement here: https://t.co/5YteTR6wQa

Last week we passed the #CARESAct which provides assistance to Americans with tax relief, expanded unemployment benefits for those who need it, and helps our businesses stay afloat so we can resume a strong economy when the pandemic subsides. My column: https://t.co/JsFMoPT1F7

Technologies such as #telehealth are critical to providing Medicare beneficiaries health care access while preventing unnecessary risks to those most vulnerable. Because of this, @RepOHalleran and I led a letter supporting telehealth in the #COVID19 package. https://t.co/r3UKXvGeja

Today on #NationalAgDay we owe our ag producers a great deal of thanks for all they do to feed the world. During the #COVID19 outbreak, we have seen first-hand the importance of food production and how much we rely on our producers. Thank you!

While the COVID-19 outbreak continues, drastic measures have been put in place to slow the spread. Due to the seriousness of this issue, @POTUS has taken actions to keep us safe. My column here:  https://t.co/rR3KhoCGKO

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19, the upcoming public events in Hebron, Falls City, Geneva, Pawnee City and Arthur have been postponed. Please contact my office via https://t.co/DUWpuzCTAS if you need assistance or to share your concerns. #NE03 https://t.co/rbEBvZc5HU

Thank you, @realDonaldTrump for cutting red tape for ethanol producers to make alcohol for much-needed hand sanitizer, and for motor carriers who are transporting essential supplies and equipment.  Rural America stands ready to help fight #COVID19.

New alert from @SocialSecurity Inspector General - While SSA is providing telephone service only due to COVID-19, any claims of a benefit cut because of Coronavirus are a scam. More info here - https://t.co/Uzqx2j6meq

Because of the COVID-19 national emergency, Treasury has deferred tax payment deadlines by 90 days.  This deadline only applies to payments – the tax filing deadline remains April 15.  More info here: https://t.co/PcMj3AF9mq

Reminder – Veterans who believe they are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms should contact their local VA health facility by telephone, not immediately go there in person. More Coronavirus info for veterans can be found here: https://t.co/KsXI1xN3gz

Americans are rightfully taking steps to protect themselves, their families, friends, and neighbors from transmission of #coronavirus and I am grateful for the leadership of @realDonaldTrump during this trying time. My column here:  https://t.co/QlUnoSoNBT
.@POTUS has released important recommendations for slowing the spread of COVID-19.  Please read, and stay safe!  https://t.co/JJ7Sni0Eka

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19, Saturday’s Service Academy Open House at @kearneylib is postponed. For assistance with the academy nomination process, please contact my Grand Island office.  #NE03 https://t.co/oioX1UlLIS

Due to health & safety concerns with COVID-19, along with recommendation of social distancing from @POTUS, @GovRicketts, @CDCgov, & out of an abundance of caution, my office will be postponing tomorrow’s Staff Mobile Office in Kimball. #NE03 https://t.co/mqHyxkNZye

Glad to introduce the RUSH Act with @SenJohnThune @RepAnnieKuster @SenatorCardin which will help transform rural health care and improve lives by helping eliminate unnecessary travel for seniors in nursing homes. https://t.co/havXTjBWeW

. @POTUS has been adamant from the very beginning we must take #coronavirus seriously. The package we passed today in the House will be critical to preventing the spread of this disease. My statement here: https://t.co/F6ivpyiLDX

Because timeliness is key in fights against infectious diseases like #coronovirus we must come up with a bipartisan solution as soon as possible. I thank @realDonaldTrump for his quick action in this fight. My column here: https://t.co/vlIuuF04MN

At today’s @WaysandMeansGOP hearing, I asked @SecAzar about the administration’s response to the #coronavirus and discussed the key role @unmc plays in efforts to combat this virus. Watch my remarks here: https://t.co/M389gYeDsz
Thanks to the leadership and staff of @GPHealthcare for an in-depth visit and tour this morning. #NE03 https://t.co/DSxEkUcJ6u
Yesterday, I met with Nebraskans from the @RuralHealth Association where we discussed the challenges facing rural hospitals. https://t.co/VxCfnwDXv8

Innovation is key to improving health care, but testing new care models without oversight or transparency can hurt patients and providers. To fix this Rep. Terri Sewell and I have introduced a bill providing commonsense guardrails for CMMI. Read more here: https://t.co/PCha74yNOo

Once again federal courts have found Obamacare’s individual mandate unconstitutional. I remain committed to utilizing market-based solutions like association health plans to reduce costs for Nebraska’s families, farmers, ranchers, and small businesses. https://t.co/bnPtnvqz9z
Thanks to all who stopped by my Mobile Office in Hildreth.  I enjoyed the engaging discussion on #USMCA, health care, and the need to cut federal regulation. #NE03 https://t.co/iFAK0144qa
Thanks to Brodstone Memorial Hospital for an update this morning.  I appreciated hearing more about their work to support Superior and Nuckolls County. #NE03 https://t.co/Jwve9dUxNd

I always enjoy stopping by @NewsChannelNE & @kwbe1450 of Beatrice.  I appreciated the opportunity to share my perspective on important issues facing our country like #USMCA, health care, and immigration. #NE03 https://t.co/acAxD20Dpg

Great meeting with the @NebraskaChamber this morning about health care, workforce issues, and trade. We must pass #USMCA . Our producers, manufacturers, innovators, and consumers stand to benefit by the enactment of this trade deal. https://t.co/TnJcgnxp43

Congratulations to the Evergreen Assisted Living Facility on their expansion. I enjoyed the opportunity to visit with residents and staff, and hear their thoughts on Medicare, improving rural health care, cutting federal regulation, and strengthening our workforce. #NE03 https://t.co/0xdgCPrCUv

Thanks to @ONeillNebraska Chamber of Commerce for today’s meeting.  I appreciated our discussion on the importance of trade, health care, rural broadband, and the need to fix our immigration system. #NE03 https://t.co/ihQD4vQC1R
I am pleased to see @POTUS take executive action to strengthen Medicare Advantage and telehealth – both vitally important to Nebraskans. https://t.co/dYn2svY0vR
Access to mental health care is a pressing issue, especially in rural areas like #NE03 where distance and lack of providers are frequent challenges. Read my column here: https://t.co/qst3Yzutc9

I spoke at a health care conference hosted by @HealthInFocus earlier this week where I was able to discuss legislation I am drafting to create guardrails for CMMI. Currently CMMI operates without Congressional or Judicial oversight, which is what my bill would fix. https://t.co/UsERmjhGvl

In August, my casework staff was able to close 31 cases with agencies such as the VA, USDA, Social Security, Medicare, and others. If you are in need of help with a federal agency, please reach out to my office or visit: https://t.co/ybY5Fu4Kc2 #NE03
RT @PQHH: Thanks @RepAdrianSmith for supporting the Home Health Payment Innovation Act (H.R. 2573)! https://t.co/rRDPCnFxyz

Thanks to the staff of the Alliance Community Pharmacy for a tour of their facility yesterday. I appreciated learning more about how they educate their communities and encourage individuals to make good health care decisions. #NE03 https://t.co/BLjPqb8nq4

Last month, my casework staff was able to close 22 cases, helping NE03 constituents with the VA, USDA, State Department, USCIS, FEMA, Treasury, Social Security, IRS & the Dept of Education. If you need help w/ a federal agency, visit https://t.co/ybY5Fu4Kc2

Arbitrary ACA reporting mandates burden employers who provide health insurance. I co-introduced the bipartisan HR 4070 to create a more efficient reporting system and reduce the risk of surprise financial penalties for employers & employees.

One of my top priorities is improving health care for rural Americans. Empowering providers to better meet the needs of patients and reducing burdensome regulations can go a long way to streamline and strengthen our health care system. Read my column here: https://t.co/itcwa8K4rk

Appreciated the opportunity to meet directly with Cheyenne County constituents yesterday.  Hearing  their perspective on health care, trade, the state of the economy, and many other issues is an important part of the policy development process. https://t.co/sv2qu8lIAe

In today’s Ways and Means hearing, I discussed efforts to combat maternal mortality and the introduction of my bill, the Rural Health Clinic Modernization Act. You can watch my remarks here: https://t.co/b4mt265UPl
